Overview Package Class Index No Frames Frames Prev Next

Summary: TYPE CONSTANT VARIABLE FUNCTION
fgl

fglcdvBluetoothLE

Genero BDL wrapper around the Cordova Bluetooth Low Energy plugin.

Steps to act as a central BluetoothLE device:

-- 1. Initialize the BLE plugin

-- 2. Scan to get BLE device addresses

-- 3. Connect to a device using its address

-- 4. Discover BLE device services

-- 5. Read/Write a characteristic or descriptor

-- 6. Subscribe to a BLE service.characteristic / Unsubscribe

-- 7. Close connection

Most important functions are asynchronous and results need to be handled in an ON ACTION cordovacallback handler, using processCallbackEvents()

END RECORD

Variables

initOptions

DEFINE initOptions InitOptionsT

Functions

askForCoarseLocationPermission

FUNCTION askForCoarseLocationPermission() RETURNS BOOLEAN

If not allowed, ask permission for coarse location (Android).

Note that this function is called automatically when doing a startScan().

Returns:
TRUE if coarse location is allowed, otherwise FALSE.

canClose

FUNCTION canClose(address STRING)

Indicates if it is possible to close the connection from the specified device.

It is not possible to close a connection if subscriptions are active.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
Returns:
TRUE if close is possible, otherwise FALSE.

canConnect

FUNCTION canConnect(address STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if connection to the specified device address is possible.

Connection is not possible if scanning was not done.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
Returns:
TRUE if connection is possible, otherwise FALSE.

canDiscover

FUNCTION canDiscover(address STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if it is possible to discover device services.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
Returns:
TRUE if discovery is possible, otherwise FALSE.

canInitialize

FUNCTION canInitialize() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if the BLE plugin can be initialized.

Returns:
TRUE when initialization is possible, FALSE otherwise.

canStartScan

FUNCTION canStartScan() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if BLE device scanning is possible.

This function is typically called to enable/disable dialog actions depending on the current states.

Returns:
TRUE if scanning is possible, otherwise FALSE.

canStopScan

FUNCTION canStopScan() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if BLE device scanning can be stopped.

This function is typically called to enable/disable dialog actions depending on the current states.

Returns:
TRUE if stop scanning is possible, otherwise FALSE.

canSubscribe

FUNCTION canSubscribe(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if subscription to the specified characteristic is possible.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
TRUE if subscription is possible, otherwise FALSE.

canUnsubscribe

FUNCTION canUnsubscribe(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if it is possible to unsubscribe to a characteristic.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
TRUE if unsubscription is possible, otherwise FALSE.

clearCallbackBuffer

FUNCTION clearCallbackBuffer()

Clears the internal buffer for callback data records.

clearScanResultBuffer

FUNCTION clearScanResultBuffer()

Clears the internal buffer for scan results.

clearSubscriptionResultBuffer

FUNCTION clearSubscriptionResultBuffer()

Cleanup subscription result buffer.

close

FUNCTION close(address STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Close the connection to a device.

Check if close is possible with the canClose(address) function.

Parameters:
address - the address of the BLE device to disconnect, as returned in scan results.
Returns:
<0 in case of error, 0 if ok.

connect

FUNCTION connect(address STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Connect to the BLE device identified by its address.

After scanning for BLE devices, call this function to connect to one of the devices.

Check if connect is possible with the canConnect(address) function.

The connection is asynchronous and results need to be processed with the cordovacallback action and processCallbackEvents().

If a first connection failed or was closed, call this function again to try to reconnect.

Check the connection status with the getConnectionStatus(address) function:

- CONNECT_STATUS_UNDEFINED : Not yet connected

- CONNECT_STATUS_CONNECTING : Connection is in progress

- CONNECT_STATUS_CONNECTED : Connected to the device

- CONNECT_STATUS_DISCONNECTED : Disconnected from the device

- CONNECT_STATUS_CLOSED : Connection was closed

- CONNECT_STATUS_FAILED : Connection failed

Parameters:
address - the address of the BLE device to connect to, as returned in scan results.
Returns:
<0 in case of error, 0 if ok.

connectStatusToString

FUNCTION connectStatusToString(s SMALLINT) RETURNS STRING

Provides a display text corresponding to the connection status.

Parameters:
s - the connection status (from getConnectionStatus() for example)
Returns:
the connection status as text.

discover

FUNCTION discover(address STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Fetch available services and characteritics from the specified device.

This call is synchronous (result does not need to be handled with cordovacallback action)

After calling this function successfully, use the getDiscoveryResults() function to get service and characteristic information of the discovered devices.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
Returns:
<0 in case of error, 0 if ok.

discoveryStatusToString

FUNCTION discoveryStatusToString(s SMALLINT) RETURNS STRING

Provides a display text corresponding to the discovery status.

Parameters:
s - the discovery status (from getDiscoveryStatus() for example)
Returns:
the discovery status as text.

fini

FUNCTION fini()

Finalizes the plugin library

The fini() function should be called when the library is no longer used.

getCallbackDataEvents

FUNCTION getCallbackDataEvents(bge BgEventArrayT)

Provides all callback data records collected.

Parameters:
bge - the array of background events to fill.

getCharacteristicPermissions

FUNCTION getCharacteristicPermissions(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS PermissionsT

Provides all permissions of a service characteristic.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
the set of characteristic permissions.

getCharacteristicProperties

FUNCTION getCharacteristicProperties(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS CharacteristicPropertiesT

Provides all properties of a service characteristic.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
the set of characteristic properties.

Returns:
CONNECTION_STATUS_* values.

Parameters:

Returns:
device name.

drd - the array to hold discovery results.

Provides the JSON object containing last error information.

Returns:
the JSON object with error info, or NULL of no error

FUNCTION getLastErrorMessage() RETURNS STRING

Provides the description of the last error.

Returns:
the error message.

getNewScanResults

FUNCTION getNewScanResults(sra ScanResultArrayT)

Provides new scan results collected since the last call to this function.

Parameters:
sra - the array of scan results to fill.

FUNCTION getNewSubscriptionResults(sra SubscribeResultArrayT)

Provides new subscription results collected since the last call to this function.

Parameters:
sra - the array to hold subscription results.

FUNCTION getScanResults(sra ScanResultArrayT)

Provides all scan results collected during the BLE scan.

Parameters:
sra - the array of scan results to fill.

getScanStatus

FUNCTION getScanStatus() RETURNS SMALLINT

Provides the current scan status.

Returns:
SCAN_STATUS_* values.

getSubscriptionResults

FUNCTION getSubscriptionResults(sra SubscribeResultArrayT)

Returns subscription results for all subscribed characteristics.

Results can be filtered by using the .address, .service and .characteristic members of the array record.

Parameters:
sra - the array to hold subscription results.

getSubscriptionStatus

FUNCTION getSubscriptionStatus(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Provides the subscription status for a given characteristic.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
SUBSCRIBE_STATUS_* values.

hasActiveSubscriptions

FUNCTION hasActiveSubscriptions(address STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if subscriptions are currently active for the specified device.

After subscribing to a service/characteristic, you need first to unsubscribe before closing the connection to the device.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
Returns:
TRUE if this device is used for subscriptions, otherwise FALSE.

hasCharacteristic

FUNCTION hasCharacteristic(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Indicates if the BLE device has a specific service characteristic.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
TRUE the characteristic is available, otherwise FALSE.

hasCoarseLocationPermission

FUNCTION hasCoarseLocationPermission() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Checks if the current device allows coarse location (Android).

Note that this function is called automatically when doing a startScan().

Returns:
TRUE if coarse location is allowed, otherwise FALSE.

init

FUNCTION init()

Initializes the plugin library

The init() function must be called prior to other calls.

initializationStatusToString

FUNCTION initializationStatusToString(s SMALLINT) RETURNS STRING

Provides a display text corresponding to the initialization status.

Parameters:
s - the initialization status (from getInitializationStatus() for example)
Returns:
the initialization status as text.

initialize

FUNCTION initialize(initMode SMALLINT, initOptions InitOptionsT) RETURNS INTEGER

Initializes BLE

Parameters:
initMode - INIT_MODE_CENTRAL (INIT_MODE_PERIPHERAL not supported yet)
initOptions - the initialization options of (see InitOptionsT)
Returns:
0 on success, <0 if error.

isConnected

FUNCTION isConnected(address STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Checks if the given BLE device is connected.

Parameters:
address - is the device address to check.
Returns:
TRUE when connected, otherwise FALSE.

isInitialized

FUNCTION isInitialized() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Checks if initialization is done.

Returns:
TRUE when initialized, otherwise FALSE.

isScanning

FUNCTION isScanning() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Checks if BLE device scan is in progress.

Returns:
TRUE when scanning, otherwise FALSE.

processCallbackEvents

FUNCTION processCallbackEvents() RETURNS INTEGER

Processes BluetoothLE Cordova plugin callback events

This function has to be called in an ON ACTION cordovacallbak handler: Some BLE calls like close as synchronous, while others need to be called asynchroneously, where results are fetched with the callback mechanism.

 ON ACTION cordovacallback ATTRIBUTES(DEFAULTVIEW=NO)
    LET n = fglcdvBluetoothLE.processCallbackEvents()
    IF n >= 0 THEN
       MESSAGE SFMT("%1 events processed.",n)
    ELSE
       ERROR SFMT("error %1 while processing callback results:\n%3",
                   n, fglcdvBluetoothLE.getLastErrorMessage() )
    END IF

Returns:
<0 if error. Otherwise, the number of callback data events processed.

read

FUNCTION read(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT, STRING

Read the value of the specified service characteristic.

This call is synchronous (result does not need to be handled with cordovacallback action)

The GATT characteristic value is encoded in Base64, and can be the representation of some text, numeric or binary data.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
1: <0 in case of error, 0 if ok.
2: the Base64 encoded value.

readDescriptor

FUNCTION readDescriptor(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING, descriptor STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT, STRING

Read the value of the specified characteristic descriptor.

This call is synchronous (result does not need to be handled with cordovacallback action)

The GATT descriptor value is encoded in Base64, and can be the representation of some text, numeric or binary data.

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
descriptor - the UUID of the GATT descriptor.
Returns:
1: <0 in case of error, 0 if ok.
2: the Base64 encoded value.

scanStatusToString

FUNCTION scanStatusToString(s SMALLINT) RETURNS STRING

Provides a display text corresponding to the scan status.

Parameters:
s - the scan status (from getScanStatus() for example)
Returns:
the scan status as text.

startScan

FUNCTION startScan(scanOptions ScanOptionsT) RETURNS INTEGER

Starts BLE scanning

When initialization is done, it is possible to scan for BLE devices.

Check if scanning is possible with the canStartScan() function.

Use the predefined fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions module variable to define scan options.

On Android, the function automatically asks for coarse location permission if not currently granted. If this permission is denied by the user, the function returns -2.

The scan is asynchronous and results need to be processed with the cordovacallback action and processCallbackEvents().

Check the scanning status with the getScanStatus() function:

- SCAN_STATUS_STARTED: The scan is starting, waiting for results.

- SCAN_STATUS_RESULTS: Scan results are available with getScanResults().

 INITIALIZE fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.* TO NULL
 IF fen == "GMA" THEN
    LET fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.scanMode = fglcdvBluetoothLE.SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER
    LET fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.matchMode = fglcdvBluetoothLE.MATCH_MODE_AGRESSIVE
    LET fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.matchNum = fglcdvBluetoothLE.MATCH_NUM_ONE_ADVERTISEMENT
    LET fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.callbackType = fglcdvBluetoothLE.CALLBACK_TYPE_ALL_MATCHES
 ELSE
    LET fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.allowDuplicates = FALSE
 END IF
 LET fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.services[1] = "180D"
 LET fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.services[2] = "180F"
 IF fglcdvBluetoothLE.startScan( fglcdvBluetoothLE.scanOptions.* ) >= 0 THEN
    MESSAGE "BluetoothLE scan started."
 ELSE
    ERROR "BluetoothLE scan failed to start."
 END IF

Parameters:
scanOptions - a record of type ScanOptionsT to provide scan options.
Returns:
<0 in case of error, 0 if ok.

stopScan

FUNCTION stopScan() RETURNS INTEGER

Stops BLE scanning

After retrieving scan results from startScan(), stop scanning with stopScan().

This call is synchronous (result does not need to be handled with cordovacallback action)

Returns:
SCAN_STATUS_STOPPED or SCAN_STATUS_FAILED.

subscribe

FUNCTION subscribe(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Subscribes to a characteristic of the BLE device.

After discovering BLE device services, it is possible to subscribe to characteristics that have the notify and indicate properties (CharacteristicPropertiesT).

To verify if subscription is possible for a given characteristic, use canSubscribe().

The subscription is asynchronous and results need to be processed with the cordovacallback action and processCallbackEvents().

Check for available results with the getSubscriptionStatus() function:

- SUBSCRIBE_STATUS_SUBSCRIBING : Subscription is in progress.

- SUBSCRIBE_STATUS_SUBSCRIBED : Subscription is done.

- SUBSCRIBE_STATUS_RESULTS : Results are available with getSubscriptionResults()

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
<0 in case of error, 0 if ok.

subscriptionStatusToString

FUNCTION subscriptionStatusToString(s SMALLINT) RETURNS STRING

Provides a display text corresponding to the subscription status.

Parameters:
s - the subscription status (from getSubscriptionStatus() for example)
Returns:
the subscription status as text.

unsubscribe

FUNCTION unsubscribe(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Unsubscribes to a characteristic of the BLE device.

After subscribing to a BLE device service, call this function to unsubscribe.

To verify if unsubscription is possible for a given characteristic, use canUnsubscribe().

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
Returns:
<0 in case of error, 0 if ok.

wasConnected

FUNCTION wasConnected(address STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Checks if the given BLE device was connected.

Parameters:
address - is the device address to check.
Returns:
TRUE when it was connected, otherwise FALSE.

write

FUNCTION write(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING, value STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Write the value of the specified service characteristic.

This call is synchronous (result does not need to be handled with cordovacallback action)

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
value - the GATT characteristic value in Base64 encoding.
Returns:
<0 in case of error, 0 if ok.

writeDescriptor

FUNCTION writeDescriptor(address STRING, service STRING, characteristic STRING, descriptor STRING, value STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Write the value of the specified characteristic descriptor.

This call is synchronous (result does not need to be handled with cordovacallback action)

Parameters:
address - the address of a BLE device.
service - the UUID of the GATT service.
characteristic - the UUID of the GATT characteristic.
descriptor - the UUID of the GATT descriptor.
value - the GATT descriptor value in Base64 encoding.
Returns:
<0 in case of error, 0 if ok.
